creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
Right now, "All|None|directive-type [directive-type]..." is mentioned.

It would be great if a web admin could in general allow users who may own a
subdirectory of a document tree to set an .htaccess of their desire as long as
it is more restrictive than the glowal settings.
I suggest an additional directive "Restrict" for this.

This would disallow rights-expansion as described in
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=16801

If there are already ways to do that easily, it would be great to mention them
in the documentation at the above referenced URL.

The term "more restrictive" is almost impossible to define in this context.
I don't know exactly what you mean by it, and I can't imagine any way
to make it consistent and general.
creator: slive@apache.org
hauser@acm.org
text:
At least for example for "Require" it would be any subset of the users listed on
the top level. Sure, for others, it may be less obvious, but for most
directives, I am sure that it will be possible to come up with some reasonable
order.

For Options
* FollowSymLinks --> SymLinksIfOwnerMatch --> Nothing
* Includes --> IncludesNOEXEC --> ...
* ...

creator: rbowen@apache.org
text:
Closing. This feature has been implemented, albeit with a different syntax than suggested.


See https://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/mod/core.html#allowoverridelist for the documentation of this feature.
